title: Dua Lipa loved this North End restaurant so much she went there twice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Dua Lipa dined at Neptune Oyster in Boston's North End, enjoying oysters and a lobster roll twice in a week.
The pop star also visited The Red Fox for martinis, an Italian restaurant opened by All Day Hospitality Group.
Dua Lipa was in Boston for her 'Radical Optimism' tour, with performances at TD Garden on Sept. 9 and 10.

title: 2025 Emmys predictions: Who will win, who will get snubbed
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Severance,' 'Adolescence,' and 'The Studio' expected to dominate 2025 Emmys according to predictions.
Predictions suggest Kathy Bates will win Best Actress Drama for 'Matlock', while Britt Lower from 'Severance' is favored by critics.
Critics believe Seth Rogen will win Best Actor Comedy for 'The Studio', while Jean Smart is predicted for Best Actress Comedy for 'Hacks'.

title: Alex Bregman shares his advice for younger Red Sox teammates down the stretch
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Alex Bregman advises younger teammates to stay calm and simplify their approach as Red Sox push for playoffs.
Red Sox hold the second AL wildcard spot with a 81-68 record, needing strong finish in last 13 games.
Bregman hits first home run since August in a recent loss, despite team's struggles against the Yankees.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s 1-1 draw vs. Toronto FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution drew 1-1 with Toronto FC, with Luca Langoni scoring a late equalizer at Gillette Stadium.
Despite the draw, New England Revolution remains 11th in the Eastern Conference with playoff hopes dimming after Chicago's loss.
18-year-old Allan Oyirwoth made his first MLS start, showing promise in central midfield despite New England's ongoing challenges.

title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox hold the second wild-card spot in the American League, trailing Yankees and Blue Jays in standings.
Manager Alex Cora advises against focusing on playoffs too soon, despite team's favorable postseason odds.
Red Sox face a tougher schedule compared to Rangers, impacting playoff race dynamics in coming weeks.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow is seeking a general manager to serve as second-in-command this offseason.
The general manager position is vacant since Breslow's hiring ahead of the 2024 season.
Assistant GMs Raquel Ferreira, Eddie Romero, and others are potential candidates for the GM role.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints for a 2027 sixth-round pick.
The Patriots also traded away a 2028 seventh-round pick in the deal for Polk.
Polk had 12 receptions, 87 yards, and two touchdowns in his 2024 rookie season with the Patriots.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots have lost their last five games against the Dolphins in Miami ahead of their Week 2 match-up.
Dolphins head coach Mike McDaniel faces scrutiny after a 33-8 loss to the Colts and a players-only meeting.
Miami's QB Tua Tagovailoa remains undefeated against the Patriots, winning all seven games since joining the team.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed at Boston's Roadrunner on September 12, delivering a theatrical Southern Gothic-themed concert.
The show featured songs from Cain's albums, including the prequel 'Willoughby Tucker, Iâ€™ll Always Love You'.
Ethel Cain described the Boston concert as the best show of the tour, with high audience energy and engagement.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars as Mike Flynt in the film 'The Senior', depicting Flynt's return to college football at age 59.
Chiklis, an Andover High alum, hadn't played tackle football since high school before taking on this challenging role.
The film 'The Senior', directed by Rod Lurie, is set for national release on September 19, 2025.
